metadata.title: RHSA-2022:8917: Red Hat JBoss Web Server 5.7.1 release and security update (Moderate)
metadata.description:
Red Hat JBoss Web Server is a fully integrated and certified set of components for hosting Java web applications. It is comprised of the Apache Tomcat Servlet container, JBoss HTTP Connector (mod_cluster), the PicketLink Vault extension for Apache Tomcat, and the Tomcat Native library.

This release of Red Hat JBoss Web Server 5.7.1 serves as a replacement for Red Hat JBoss Web Server 5.7.0. This release includes bug fixes, enhancements and component upgrades, which are documented in the Release Notes, linked to in the References.

Security Fix(es):

* openssl: c_rehash script allows command injection (CVE-2022-1292)

* openssl: the c_rehash script allows command injection (CVE-2022-2068)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

bugzilla.text: the c_rehash script allows command injection

platform: Red Hat JBoss Web Server 5.7 on RHEL 7

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
jws5-tomcat-native is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
